CreateAIAnalysisTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom content analysis template. Up to 50 templates can be created.
CreateAIAnalysisTemplate.name: Creates content analysis template

CreateAIRecognitionTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom content recognition template. Up to 50 templates can be created.
CreateAIRecognitionTemplate.name: Creates a content recognition template

CreateAdaptiveDynamicStreamingTemplate.document: This API is used to create an adaptive bitrate streaming template. Up up to 100 such templates can be created.
CreateAdaptiveDynamicStreamingTemplate.name: Creates adaptive bitrate streaming templates

CreateAnimatedGraphicsTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom animated image generating template. Up to 16 templates can be created.
CreateAnimatedGraphicsTemplate.name: Creates an animated image generating template

CreateContentReviewTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom content moderation template. Up to 50 templates can be created in total.
CreateContentReviewTemplate.name: Creates a content moderation template

CreateImageSpriteTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom image sprite generating template. Up to 16 templates can be created.
CreateImageSpriteTemplate.name: Creates an image sprite generating template

CreatePersonSample.document: This API is used to create image samples for video processing operations such as content recognition and inappropriate information detection with the help of technologies such as facial feature positioning.
CreatePersonSample.name: Creates image samples

CreateSampleSnapshotTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom sampled screencapturing template. Up to 16 templates can be created.
CreateSampleSnapshotTemplate.name: Creates a sampled screencapturing template

CreateSnapshotByTimeOffsetTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom time point screencapturing template. Up to 16 templates can be created.
CreateSnapshotByTimeOffsetTemplate.name: Creates a time point screencapturing template

CreateTranscodeTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom transcoding template. Up to 1,000 templates can be created.
CreateTranscodeTemplate.name: Creates a transcoding template

CreateWatermarkTemplate.document: This API is used to create a custom watermarking template. Up to 1,000 templates can be created.
CreateWatermarkTemplate.name: Creates a watermarking template

CreateWordSamples.document: This API is used to create keyword samples in batches for video processing operations such as content recognition and inappropriate information detection with the help of the OCR and ASR technologies.
CreateWordSamples.name: Creates keyword samples

CreateWorkflow.document:
This API is used to create a workflow for media files uploaded to a specified COS bucket. A workflow may include the following tasks:
1. Video transcoding (with watermark)
2. Animated image generating
3. Time point screencapturing
4. Sampled screencapturing
5. Image sprite generating
6. Adaptive bitrate streaming
7. Intelligent content moderation (detection of pornographic and sensitive content)
8. Intelligent content analysis (labeling, categorization, thumbnail generation, frame-specific labeling)
9. Intelligent content recognition (face, full text, text keyword, full speech, and speech keyword)

Note: A workflow is disabled upon creation. You need to manually enable it.
CreateWorkflow.name: Creates a workflow

DeleteAIAnalysisTemplate.document:
This API is used to delete a custom content analysis template.

Note: templates with an ID below 10000 are preset and cannot be deleted.
DeleteAIAnalysisTemplate.name: Deletes content analysis template

DeleteAIRecognitionTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a custom content recognition template.
DeleteAIRecognitionTemplate.name: Deletes a content recognition template

DeleteAdaptiveDynamicStreamingTemplate.document: This API is used to delete an adaptive bitrate streaming template.
DeleteAdaptiveDynamicStreamingTemplate.name: Deletes an adaptive bitrate streaming template

DeleteAnimatedGraphicsTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a custom animated image generating template.
DeleteAnimatedGraphicsTemplate.name: Deletes an animated image generating template

DeleteContentReviewTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a custom content moderation template.
DeleteContentReviewTemplate.name: Deletes a content moderation template

DeleteImageSpriteTemplate.document: This API is used to delete an image sprite generating template.
DeleteImageSpriteTemplate.name: Deletes an image sprite generating template

DeletePersonSample.document: This API is used to delete image samples by image ID.
DeletePersonSample.name: Deletes image samples

DeleteSampleSnapshotTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a custom sampled screencapturing template.
DeleteSampleSnapshotTemplate.name: Deletes a sampled screencapturing template

DeleteSnapshotByTimeOffsetTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a custom time point screencapturing template.
DeleteSnapshotByTimeOffsetTemplate.name: Deletes a time point screencapturing template

DeleteTranscodeTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a custom transcoding template.
DeleteTranscodeTemplate.name: Deletes a transcoding template

DeleteWatermarkTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a custom watermarking template.
DeleteWatermarkTemplate.name: Deletes a watermarking template

DeleteWordSamples.document: This API is used to delete keyword samples in batches.
DeleteWordSamples.name: Deletes keyword samples

DeleteWorkflow.document: This API is used to delete a workflow. An enabled workflow must be disabled before it can be deleted.
DeleteWorkflow.name: Deletes a workflow

DescribeAIAnalysisTemplates.document: This API is used to get the list of content analysis templates based on unique template ID. The returned result includes all eligible custom and preset video content analysis templates.
DescribeAIAnalysisTemplates.name: Gets content analysis template list

DescribeAIRecognitionTemplates.document: This API is used to get the list of content recognition templates based on unique template ID. The return result includes all eligible custom and preset content recognition templates.
DescribeAIRecognitionTemplates.name: Gets the list of content recognition templates

DescribeAdaptiveDynamicStreamingTemplate.document: This API is used to query the list of adaptive bitrate streaming templates and supports paginated queries by filters.
DescribeAdaptiveDynamicStreamingTemplate.name: Gets the list of adaptive bitrate streaming templates

DescribeAnimatedGraphicsTemplates.document: This API is used to query the list of animated image generating templates and supports paged queries by filters.
DescribeAnimatedGraphicsTemplates.name: Gets the list of animated image generating templates

DescribeContentReviewTemplates.document: This API is used to query content moderation templates by template ID. Both custom and preset templates that match the template IDs passed in will be returned.
DescribeContentReviewTemplates.name: Queries content moderation templates

DescribeImageSpriteTemplates.document: This API is used to query the list of image sprite generating templates and supports paged queries by filters.
DescribeImageSpriteTemplates.name: Gets the list of image sprite generating templates

DescribeMediaMetaData.document: This API is used to get the metadata of media, such as video image width/height, codec, length, and frame rate.
DescribeMediaMetaData.name: Gets media metadata

DescribePersonSamples.document: This API is used to query the information of image samples. It supports paginated queries by image ID, name, and tag.
DescribePersonSamples.name: Gets the list of image samples

DescribeSampleSnapshotTemplates.document: This API is used to query the list of sampled screencapturing templates and supports paged queries by filters.
DescribeSampleSnapshotTemplates.name: Gets the list of sampled screencapturing templates

DescribeSnapshotByTimeOffsetTemplates.document: This API is used to query the list of time point screencapturing templates and supports paged queries by filters.
DescribeSnapshotByTimeOffsetTemplates.name: Gets the list of time point screencapturing templates

DescribeTaskDetail.document: This API is used to query the details of execution status and result of a task submitted in the last 3 days by task ID.
DescribeTaskDetail.name: Queries task details

DescribeTasks.name: Gets the task list

DescribeTranscodeTemplates.document: This API is used to get the list of transcoding templates based on unique template ID. The return result includes all eligible custom and [preset transcoding templates](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/266/33476?from_cn_redirect=1#.E9.A2.84.E7.BD.AE.E8.BD.AC.E7.A0.81.E6.A8.A1.E6.9D.BF).
DescribeTranscodeTemplates.name: Gets the list of transcoding templates

DescribeWatermarkTemplates.document: This API is used to query custom watermarking templates and supports paged queries by filters.
DescribeWatermarkTemplates.name: Gets the list of watermarking templates

DescribeWordSamples.document: This API is used to perform paged queries of keyword sample information by use case, keyword, and tag.
DescribeWordSamples.name: Gets the list of keyword samples

DescribeWorkflows.document: This API is used to get the list of workflow details by workflow ID.
DescribeWorkflows.name: Get the workflow list

DisableWorkflow.document: This API is used to disable a workflow.
DisableWorkflow.name: Disables a workflow

EditMedia.name: Edits video

EnableWorkflow.document: This API is used to enable a workflow.
EnableWorkflow.name: Enables a workflow

ExecuteFunction.document: This API is reserved for special circumstances. Do not use it unless you are directed to use it by technical support.
ExecuteFunction.name: Runs a custom API

ManageTask.document: This API is used to manage initiated tasks.
ManageTask.name: Manages task

ModifyAIAnalysisTemplate.document:
This API is used to modify a custom content analysis template.

Note: templates with an ID below 10000 are preset and cannot be modified.
ModifyAIAnalysisTemplate.name: Modifies content analysis template

ModifyAIRecognitionTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a custom content recognition template.
ModifyAIRecognitionTemplate.name: Modifies a content recognition template

ModifyAdaptiveDynamicStreamingTemplate.document: This API is used to modify an adaptive bitrate streaming template.
ModifyAdaptiveDynamicStreamingTemplate.name: Modifies an adaptive bitrate streaming template

ModifyAnimatedGraphicsTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a custom animated image generating template.
ModifyAnimatedGraphicsTemplate.name: Modifies an animated image generating template

ModifyContentReviewTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a custom content moderation template.
ModifyContentReviewTemplate.name: Modifies a content moderation template

ModifyImageSpriteTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a custom image sprite generating template.
ModifyImageSpriteTemplate.name: Modifies an image sprite generating template

ModifyPersonSample.document: This API is used to modify image samples by image ID. You can use it to modify the name and description of an image sample and add/delete/reset facial features or tags. There must be at least one image left after the deletion of facial features; otherwise, please reset instead of delete the facial features.
ModifyPersonSample.name: Modifies image samples

ModifySampleSnapshotTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a custom sampled screencapturing template.
ModifySampleSnapshotTemplate.name: Modifies a sampled screencapturing template

ModifySnapshotByTimeOffsetTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a custom time point screencapturing template.
ModifySnapshotByTimeOffsetTemplate.name: Modifies a time point screencapturing template

ModifyTranscodeTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a custom transcoding template.
ModifyTranscodeTemplate.name: Modifies a transcoding template

ModifyWatermarkTemplate.document: This API is used to modify a custom watermarking template. The watermark type cannot be modified.
ModifyWatermarkTemplate.name: Modifies a watermarking template

ModifyWordSample.document: This API is used to modify the use case and tag of a keyword. The keyword itself cannot be modified, but you can delete it and create another one if needed.
ModifyWordSample.name: Modifies a keyword sample

ParseLiveStreamProcessNotification.document:
This API is used to parse the content of an MPS live stream processing event notification from the `msgBody` field in the message received from CMQ.
Instead of initiating a video processing task, this API is used to help generate SDKs for various programming languages. You can parse the event notification based on the analytic function of the SDKs.
ParseLiveStreamProcessNotification.name: Parses the live stream processing result

ParseNotification.document:
This API is used to parse the content of an MPS event notification from the `msgBody` field in the message received from CMQ.
Instead of initiating a video processing task, this API is used to help generate SDKs for various programming languages. You can parse the event notification based on the analytic function of the SDKs.
ParseNotification.name: Parses an event notification

ProcessLiveStream.document:
This API is used to initiate live stream processing tasks. Such tasks may include the following:

* Intelligent content moderation (detection of pornographic content in images and speech, detection of sensitive information)
* Intelligent content recognition (face, full text, text keyword, full speech, and speech keyword)

Live stream processing event notifications are written into specified CMQ queues in real time. Users need to obtain event notification results from such CMQ queues. Output files of the processing tasks are written into destination buckets specified by users.
ProcessLiveStream.name: Initiates a live stream processing task

ProcessMedia.document:
This API is used to initiate processing tasks for media files in COS. Such tasks may include the following:
1. Video transcoding (with watermark)
2. Animated image generating
3. Time point screencapturing
4. Sampled screencapturing
5. Image sprite generating
6. Adaptive bitrate streaming
7. Intelligent content moderation (detection of pornographic and sensitive content)
8. Intelligent content analysis (labeling, categorization, thumbnail generation, frame-specific labeling)
9. Intelligent content recognition (face, full text, text keyword, full speech, and speech keyword)
ProcessMedia.name: Starts a media processing task

ResetWorkflow.document: This API is used to reset an existing workflow that is disabled.
ResetWorkflow.name: Resets a workflow

  • This field is required when `Type` is `add` or `reset`;
  • Array length limit: 5 images.
    • Note: The image must be a relatively clear full-face photo of a figure in at least 200 * 200 px.

Maximum value of the width (or long side) of an animated image in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Width

members.document:
Maximum value of the height (or short side) of an animated image in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Height

members.document:
Resolution adaption. Valid values:
  • open: Enabled. In this case, `Width` represents the long side of a video, while `Height` the short side;
  • close: Disabled. In this case, `Width` represents the width of a video, while `Height` the height.

members.document:
Audio stream codec. When the outer `Container` parameter is `mp3`, the valid value is:
  • libmp3lame.
    • When the outer `Container` parameter is `ogg` or `flac`, the valid value is:
  • flac.
    • When the outer `Container` parameter is `m4a`, the valid values include:
  • libfdk_aac;
  • libmp3lame;
  • ac3.
    • When the outer `Container` parameter is `mp4` or `flv`, the valid values include:
  • libfdk_aac: more suitable for mp4;
  • libmp3lame: more suitable for flv.
    • When the outer `Container` parameter is `hls`, the valid values include:
  • libfdk_aac;
  • libmp3lame.
members.name: Codec

members.document:
Audio stream bitrate in Kbps. Value range: 0 and [26, 256].
If the value is 0, the bitrate of the audio stream will be the same as that of the original audio.

  • 32,000
  • 44,100
  • 48,000
    • In Hz.
members.name: SampleRate

members.document:
Audio channel system. Valid values:
  • 1: Mono
  • 2: Dual
  • 6: Stereo

Fill type. "Fill" refers to the way of processing a screenshot when its aspect ratio is different from that of the source video. The following fill types are supported:
  • stretch: stretch. The screenshot will be stretched frame by frame to match the aspect ratio of the source video, which may make the screenshot "shorter" or "longer";
  • black: fill with black. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with black color blocks.
    • Default value: black.

members.document:
Origin position. Valid values:
  • TopLeft: The origin of coordinates is in the top-left corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the top-left corner of the image or text;
  • TopRight: The origin of coordinates is in the top-right corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the top-right corner of the image or text;
  • BottomLeft: The origin of coordinates is in the bottom-left corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the bottom-left corner of the image or text;
  • BottomRight: The origin of coordinates is in the bottom-right corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the bottom-right corner of the image or text.
    • Default value: TopLeft.
members.name: CoordinateOrigin

members.document:
The horizontal position of the origin of the watermark relative to the origin of coordinates of the video. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `XPos` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10%` means that `XPos` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in px, the `XPos` of the watermark will be the specified px; for example, `100px` means that `XPos` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 0 px.
members.name: XPos

members.document:
The vertical position of the origin of the watermark relative to the origin of coordinates of the video. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `YPos` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10%` means that `YPos` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in px, the `YPos` of the watermark will be the specified px; for example, `100px` means that `YPos` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 0 px.
members.name: YPos

members.document:
Fill type. "Fill" refers to the way of processing a screenshot when its aspect ratio is different from that of the source video. The following fill types are supported:
  • stretch: Stretch. The screenshot will be stretched frame by frame to match the aspect ratio of the source video, which may make the screenshot "shorter" or "longer";
  • black: Fill with black. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with black color blocks.
    • Default value: black.
members.name: FillType

members.document: Template description.
members.name: Comment

ImageWatermarkInput.document: Input parameter of an image watermarking template

members.document: String generated by [Base64-encoding](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4648) a watermark image. JPEG and PNG images are supported.
members.name: ImageContent

members.document:
Watermark width. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `Width` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video width. For example, `10%` means that `Width` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in px, the `Width` of the watermark will be in pixels. For example, `100px` means that `Width` is 100 pixels. Value range: [8, 4096].
    • Default value: 10%.
members.name: Width

members.document:
Watermark height. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video height. For example, `10%` means that `Height` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in px, the `Height` of the watermark will be in pixels. For example, `100px` means that `Height` is 100 pixels. Value range: 0 or [8, 4096].
    • Default value: 0px, which means that `Height` will be proportionally scaled according to the aspect ratio of the original watermark image.
members.name: Height

members.document:
Repeat type of an animated watermark. Valid values:
  • once: no longer appears after watermark playback ends.
  • repeat_last_frame: stays on the last frame after watermark playback ends.
  • repeat (default): repeats the playback until the video ends.
members.name: RepeatType

The relationship between the values of this parameter and those of the `LabelSet` parameter in [PoliticalImgReviewTemplateInfo](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/862/37615?from_cn_redirect=1#PoliticalImgReviewTemplateInfo) is as follows: violation_photo:
  • violation_photo (banned icons)
    • politician:
  • nation_politician (state leader)
  • province_politician (provincial officials)
  • bureau_politician (bureau-level officials)
  • county_politician (county-level officials)
  • rural_politician (township-level officials)
  • sensitive_politician (sensitive people)
  • foreign_politician (state leaders of other countries)
    • entertainment:
  • sensitive_entertainment (sensitive people in the entertainment industry
    • sport:
  • sensitive_sport (sensitive sports celebrities)
    • entrepreneur:
  • sensitive_entrepreneur
    • scholar:
  • sensitive_scholar
    • celebrity:
  • sensitive_celebrity
  • historical_celebrity (sensitive historical figures)
    • military:
  • sensitive_military (sensitive people in military)

members.name: Name

members.document:
Maximum value of the width (or long side) of an animated image in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Width

members.document:
Maximum value of the height (or short side) of a video stream in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Height

members.document:
Resolution adaption. Valid values:
  • open: enabled. In this case, `Width` represents the long side of a video, while `Height` the short side;
  • close: disabled. In this case, `Width` represents the width of a video, while `Height` the height.
    • Default value: open.
members.name: ResolutionAdaptive

members.document:
Fill type. "Fill" refers to the way of processing a screenshot when its aspect ratio is different from that of the source video. The following fill types are supported:
  • stretch: stretch. The screenshot will be stretched frame by frame to match the aspect ratio of the source video, which may make the screenshot "shorter" or "longer";
  • black: fill with black. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with black color blocks.
    • Default value: black.

Fill type. "Fill" refers to the way of processing a screenshot when its aspect ratio is different from that of the source video. The following fill types are supported:
  • stretch: stretch. The screenshot will be stretched frame by frame to match the aspect ratio of the source video, which may make the screenshot "shorter" or "longer";
  • black: fill with black. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with black color blocks.
  • white: fill with white. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with white color blocks.
  • gauss: fill with Gaussian blur. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with Gaussian blur.
    • Default value: black.
members.name: FillType

Origin position. Valid values:
  • TopLeft: The origin of coordinates is in the top-left corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the top-left corner of the image or text;
  • TopRight: The origin of coordinates is in the top-right corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the top-right corner of the image or text;
  • BottomLeft: The origin of coordinates is in the bottom-left corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the bottom-left corner of the image or text;
  • BottomRight: The origin of coordinates is in the bottom-right corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the bottom-right corner of the image or text.
members.name: CoordinateOrigin

members.document:
The horizontal position of the origin of the watermark relative to the origin of coordinates of the video. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `XPos` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10%` means that `XPos` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in px, the `XPos` of the watermark will be the specified px; for example, `100px` means that `XPos` is 100 px.
members.name: XPos

members.document:
The vertical position of the origin of the watermark relative to the origin of coordinates of the video. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `YPos` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10%` means that `YPos` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in px, the `YPos` of the watermark will be the specified px; for example, `100px` means that `YPos` is 100 px.
members.name: YPos

members.document:
Origin position, which currently can only be:
  • TopLeft: the origin of coordinates is in the top-left corner of the video, and the origin of the blur is in the top-left corner of the image or text.
    • Default value: TopLeft.
members.name: CoordinateOrigin

members.document:
The horizontal position of the origin of the blur relative to the origin of coordinates of the video. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `XPos` of the blur will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10%` means that `XPos` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in px, the `XPos` of the blur will be the specified px; for example, `100px` means that `XPos` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 0 px.
members.name: XPos

members.document:
Vertical position of the origin of blur relative to the origin of coordinates of video. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `YPos` of the blur will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10%` means that `YPos` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in px, the `YPos` of the blur will be the specified px; for example, `100px` means that `YPos` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 0 px.
members.name: YPos

members.document:
Blur width. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `Width` of the blur will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10%` means that `Width` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in px, the `Width` of the blur will be in px; for example, `100px` means that `Width` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 10%.
members.name: Width

members.document:
Blur height. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `Height` of the blur will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10%` means that `Height` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in px, the `Height` of the blur will be in px; for example, `100px` means that `Height` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 10%.
members.name: Height

members.document:
Start time offset of blur in seconds. If this parameter is left empty or 0 is entered, the blur will appear upon the first video frame.
  • If this parameter is left empty or 0 is entered, the blur will appear upon the first video frame;
  • If this value is greater than 0 (e.g., n), the blur will appear at second n after the first video frame;
  • If this value is smaller than 0 (e.g., -n), the blur will appear at second n before the last video frame.
members.name: StartTimeOffset

members.document:
End time offset of blur in seconds.
  • If this parameter is left empty or 0 is entered, the blur will exist till the last video frame;
  • If this value is greater than 0 (e.g., n), the blur will exist till second n;
  • If this value is smaller than 0 (e.g., -n), the blur will exist till second n before the last video frame.
members.name: EndTimeOffset

RawImageWatermarkInput.document: Input parameter of image watermark template

members.document: Input content of watermark image. JPEG and PNG images are supported.
members.name: ImageContent

members.document:
Watermark width. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `Width` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10%` means that `Width` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in px, the `Width` of the watermark will be in px; for example, `100px` means that `Width` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 10%.
members.name: Width

members.document:
Watermark height. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10%` means that `Height` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in px, the `Height` of the watermark will be in px; for example, `100px` means that `Height` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 0 px, which means that `Height` will be proportionally scaled according to the aspect ratio of the original watermark image.
members.name: Height

members.document:
Repeat type of an animated watermark. Valid values:
  • `once`: no longer appears after watermark playback ends.
  • `repeat_last_frame`: stays on the last frame after watermark playback ends.
  • `repeat` (default): repeats the playback until the video ends.
members.name: RepeatType

members.document: Container. Valid values: mp4; flv; hls; mp3; flac; ogg; m4a. Among them, mp3, flac, ogg, and m4a are for audio files.
members.name: Container

members.document:
Whether to remove video data. Valid values:
  • 0: retain;
  • 1: remove.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: RemoveVideo

members.document:
Whether to remove audio data. Valid values:
  • 0: retain;
  • 1: remove.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: RemoveAudio

members.document: Video stream configuration parameter. This field is required when `RemoveVideo` is 0.
members.name: VideoTemplate

members.document: Audio stream configuration parameter. This field is required when `RemoveAudio` is 0.
members.name: AudioTemplate

members.document: TESHD transcoding parameter.
members.name: TEHDConfig

members.document:
Watermark type. Valid values:
  • image: image watermark.
members.name: Type

members.document:
Origin position, which currently can only be:
  • TopLeft: the origin of coordinates is in the top-left corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the top-left corner of the image or text.
    • Default value: TopLeft.
members.name: CoordinateOrigin

members.document:
The horizontal position of the origin of the watermark relative to the origin of coordinates of the video. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `XPos` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10%` means that `XPos` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in px, the `XPos` of the watermark will be the specified px; for example, `100px` means that `XPos` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 0 px.
members.name: XPos

members.document:
The vertical position of the origin of the watermark relative to the origin of coordinates of the video. % and px formats are supported:
  • If the string ends in %, the `YPos` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10%` means that `YPos` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in px, the `YPos` of the watermark will be the specified px; for example, `100px` means that `YPos` is 100 px.
    • Default value: 0 px.
members.name: YPos

members.document:
Maximum value of the width (or long side) of a screenshot in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Width

members.document:
Maximum value of the height (or short side) of a screenshot in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Height

members.document:
Resolution adaption. Valid values:
  • open: Enabled. In this case, `Width` represents the long side of a video, while `Height` the short side;
  • close: Disabled. In this case, `Width` represents the width of a video, while `Height` the height.
    • Default value: open.

members.name: UpdateTime

members.document:
Fill type. "Fill" refers to the way of processing a screenshot when its aspect ratio is different from that of the source video. The following fill types are supported:
  • stretch: Stretch. The screenshot will be stretched frame by frame to match the aspect ratio of the source video, which may make the screenshot "shorter" or "longer";
  • black: Fill with black. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with black color blocks.
  • white: Fill with white. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with white color blocks.
  • gauss: Fill with Gaussian blur. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with Gaussian blur.
    • Default value: black.
members.name: FillType

SvgWatermarkInput.document: Input parameter of an SVG watermarking template

members.document:
Watermark width, which supports six formats of px, %, W%, H%, S%, and L%:
  • If the string ends in px, the `Width` of the watermark will be in px; for example, `100px` means that `Width` is 100 px; if `0px` is entered and `Height` is not `0px`, the watermark width will be proportionally scaled based on the source SVG image; if `0px` is entered for both `Width` and `Height`, the watermark width will be the width of the source SVG image;
  • If the string ends in `W%`, the `Width` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10W%` means that `Width` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in `H%`, the `Width` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10H%` means that `Width` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in `S%`, the `Width` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the short side of the video; for example, `10S%` means that `Width` is 10% of the short side of the video;
  • If the string ends in `L%`, the `Width` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the long side of the video; for example, `10L%` means that `Width` is 10% of the long side of the video;
  • If the string ends in %, the meaning is the same as `W%`.
    • Default value: 10W%.
members.name: Width

members.document:
Watermark height, which supports six formats of px, %, W%, H%, S%, and L%:
  • If the string ends in px, the `Height` of the watermark will be in px; for example, `100px` means that `Height` is 100 px; if `0px` is entered and `Width` is not `0px`, the watermark height will be proportionally scaled based on the source SVG image; if `0px` is entered for both `Width` and `Height`, the watermark height will be the height of the source SVG image;
  • If the string ends in `W%`, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10W%` means that `Height` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in `H%`, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10H%` means that `Height` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in `S%`, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the short side of the video; for example, `10S%` means that `Height` is 10% of the short side of the video;
  • If the string ends in `L%`, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the long side of the video; for example, `10L%` means that `Height` is 10% of the long side of the video;
  • If the string ends in %, the meaning is the same as `H%`.
    • Default value: 0 px.
members.name: Height

Watermark height, which supports six formats of px, %, W%, H%, S%, and L%:
  • If the string ends in px, the `Height` of the watermark will be in px; for example, `100px` means that `Height` is 100 px; if `0px` is entered and `Width` is not `0px`, the watermark height will be proportionally scaled based on the source SVG image; if `0px` is entered for both `Width` and `Height`, the watermark height will be the height of the source SVG image;
  • If the string ends in `W%`, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10W%` means that `Height` is 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in `H%`, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10H%` means that `Height` is 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in `S%`, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the short side of the video; for example, `10S%` means that `Height` is 10% of the short side of the video;
  • If the string ends in `L%`, the `Height` of the watermark will be the specified percentage of the long side of the video; for example, `10L%` means that `Height` is 10% of the long side of the video;
  • If the string ends in %, the meaning is the same as `H%`. Default value: 0 px.
members.name: Height

  • If this parameter is set to a positive number (n for example), the transcoded video will start at the nth second of the original video.

The video codec. Valid values:
  • `libx264`: H.264
  • `libx265`: H.265
  • `av1`: AOMedia Video 1
    • Note: You must specify a resolution (not higher than 640 x 480) if the H.265 codec is used. Note: You can only use the AOMedia Video 1 codec for MP4 files.
members.name: Codec

members.document:
The video frame rate (Hz). Value range: [0, 100].
If the value is 0, the frame rate will be the same as that of the source video.
Note: For adaptive bitrate streaming, the value range of this parameter is [0, 60].
members.name: Fps

members.document:
The video bitrate (Kbps). Value range: 0 and [128, 35000].
If the value is 0, the bitrate of the video will be the same as that of the source video.
members.name: Bitrate

members.document:
Resolution adaption. Valid values:
  • open: Enabled. When resolution adaption is enabled, `Width` indicates the long side of a video, while `Height` indicates the short side.
  • close: Disabled. When resolution adaption is disabled, `Width` indicates the width of a video, while `Height` indicates the height.
    • Default value: open. Note: When resolution adaption is enabled, `Width` cannot be smaller than `Height`.
members.name: ResolutionAdaptive

members.document:
Maximum value of the width (or long side) of a video stream in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Width

members.document:
Maximum value of the height (or short side) of a video stream in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
    • Default value: 0.
members.name: Height

members.document:
Frame interval between I keyframes. Value range: 0 and [1,100000].
If this parameter is 0 or left empty, the system will automatically set the GOP length.
members.name: Gop

members.document:
The fill mode, which indicates how a video is resized when the video’s original aspect ratio is different from the target aspect ratio. Valid values:
  • stretch: Stretch the image frame by frame to fill the entire screen. The video image may become "squashed" or "stretched" after transcoding.
  • black: Keep the image's original aspect ratio and fill the blank space with black bars.
  • white: Keep the image’s original aspect ratio and fill the blank space with white bars.
  • gauss: Keep the image’s original aspect ratio and apply Gaussian blur to the blank space.
    • Default value: black. Note: Only `stretch` and `black` are supported for adaptive bitrate streaming.
members.name: FillType

members.document:
The control factor of video constant bitrate. Value range: [1, 51]
If this parameter is specified, CRF (a bitrate control method) will be used for transcoding. (Video bitrate will no longer take effect.)
It is not recommended to specify this parameter if there are no special requirements.
members.name: Vcrf

members.document:
The video codec. Valid values:
  • libx264: H.264
  • libx265: H.265
  • av1: AOMedia Video 1
    • Note: You must specify a resolution (not higher than 640 x 480) if the H.265 codec is used. Note: You can only use the AOMedia Video 1 codec for MP4 files.
members.name: Codec

members.document:
Video frame rate in Hz. Value range: [0, 100].
If the value is 0, the frame rate will be the same as that of the source video.
members.name: Fps

members.document:
Bitrate of a video stream in Kbps. Value range: 0 and [128, 35,000].
If the value is 0, the bitrate of the video will be the same as that of the source video.
members.name: Bitrate

members.document:
Resolution adaption. Valid values:
  • open: Enabled. When resolution adaption is enabled, `Width` indicates the long side of a video, while `Height` indicates the short side.
  • close: Disabled. When resolution adaption is disabled, `Width` indicates the width of a video, while `Height` indicates the height.
    • Note: When resolution adaption is enabled, `Width` cannot be smaller than `Height`.
members.name: ResolutionAdaptive

members.document:
Maximum value of the width (or long side) of a video stream in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are 0, the resolution will be the same as that of the source video;
  • If `Width` is 0, but `Height` is not 0, `Width` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If `Width` is not 0, but `Height` is 0, `Height` will be proportionally scaled;
  • If both `Width` and `Height` are not 0, the custom resolution will be used.
members.name: Width

members.document: Maximum value of the height (or short side) of a video stream in px. Value range: 0 and [128, 4,096].
members.name: Height

members.document: Frame interval between I keyframes. Value range: 0 and [1,100000]. If this parameter is 0, the system will automatically set the GOP length.
members.name: Gop

members.document:
Fill type. "Fill" refers to the way of processing a screenshot when its aspect ratio is different from that of the source video. The following fill types are supported:
  • stretch: stretch. The screenshot will be stretched frame by frame to match the aspect ratio of the source video, which may make the screenshot "shorter" or "longer";
  • black: fill with black. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with black color blocks.
  • white: fill with white. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with white color blocks.
  • gauss: fill with Gaussian blur. This option retains the aspect ratio of the source video for the screenshot and fills the unmatched area with Gaussian blur.
members.name: FillType

members.document:
The control factor of video constant bitrate. Value range: [0, 51]. This parameter will be disabled if you enter `0`.
It is not recommended to specify this parameter if there are no special requirements.
members.name: Vcrf

members.document:
Whether to enable adaptive encoding. Valid values:
  • 0: Disable
  • 1: Enable
    • Default value: 0. If this parameter is set to `1`, multiple streams with different resolutions and bitrates will be generated automatically. The highest resolution, bitrate, and quality of the streams are determined by the values of `width` and `height`, `Bitrate`, and `Vcrf` in `VideoTemplate` respectively. If these parameters are not set in `VideoTemplate`, the highest resolution generated will be the same as that of the source video, and the highest video quality will be close to VMAF 95. To use this parameter or learn about the billing details of adaptive encoding, please contact your sales rep.
members.name: ContentAdaptStream

WatermarkInput.document: The watermark parameters to use in a media processing task.

members.document: ID of a watermarking template.
members.name: Definition

members.document:
Custom watermark parameter, which is valid if `Definition` is 0.
This parameter is used in highly customized scenarios. We recommend you use `Definition` to specify the watermark parameter preferably.
Custom watermark parameter is not available for screenshot.
members.name: RawParameter

members.document:
Text content of up to 100 characters. This field is required only when the watermark type is text.
Text watermark is not available for screenshot.
members.name: TextContent

members.document:
SVG content of up to 2,000,000 characters. This field is required only when the watermark type is `SVG`.
SVG watermark is not available for screenshot.
members.name: SvgContent

members.document:
Start time offset of a watermark in seconds. If this parameter is left empty or 0 is entered, the watermark will appear upon the first video frame.
  • If this parameter is left empty or 0 is entered, the watermark will appear upon the first video frame;
  • If this value is greater than 0 (e.g., n), the watermark will appear at second n after the first video frame;
  • If this value is smaller than 0 (e.g., -n), the watermark will appear at second n before the last video frame.
members.name: StartTimeOffset

members.document:
End time offset of a watermark in seconds.
  • If this parameter is left empty or 0 is entered, the watermark will exist till the last video frame;
  • If this value is greater than 0 (e.g., n), the watermark will exist till second n;
  • If this value is smaller than 0 (e.g., -n), the watermark will exist till second n before the last video frame.
members.name: EndTimeOffset

members.document: Unique ID of a watermarking template.
members.name: Definition

members.document:
Watermark type. Valid values:
  • image: Image watermark;
  • text: Text watermark.
members.name: Type

members.document: Name of a watermarking template.
members.name: Name

members.document: Template description.
members.name: Comment

members.document:
Horizontal position of the origin of the watermark image relative to the origin of the video.
  • If the string ends in %, the `Left` edge of the watermark will be at the position of the specified percentage of the video width; for example, `10%` means that the `Left` edge is at 10% of the video width;
  • If the string ends in px, the `Left` edge of the watermark will be at the position of the specified px of the video width; for example, `100px` means that the `Left` edge is at the position of 100 px.
members.name: XPos

members.document:
Vertical position of the origin of the watermark image relative to the origin of the video.
  • If the string ends in %, the `Top` edge of the watermark will beat the position of the specified percentage of the video height; for example, `10%` means that the `Top` edge is at 10% of the video height;
  • If the string ends in px, the `Top` edge of the watermark will be at the position of the specified px of the video height; for example, `100px` means that the `Top` edge is at the position of 100 px.
members.name: YPos

members.document:
Image watermarking template. This field is valid only when `Type` is `image`.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ImageTemplate

members.document:
Text watermarking template. This field is valid only when `Type` is `text`.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TextTemplate

members.document:
SVG watermarking template. This field is valid when `Type` is `svg`.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SvgTemplate

members.document: Creation time of a template in [ISO date format](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/266/11732?from_cn_redirect=1#iso-.E6.97.A5.E6.9C.9F.E6.A0.BC.E5.BC.8F).
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: Last modified time of a template in [ISO date format](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/266/11732?from_cn_redirect=1#iso-.E6.97.A5.E6.9C.9F.E6.A0.BC.E5.BC.8F).
members.name: UpdateTime

members.document:
Origin position. Valid values:
  • topLeft: The origin of coordinates is in the top-left corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the top-left corner of the image or text;
  • topRight: The origin of coordinates is in the top-right corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the top-right corner of the image or text;
  • bottomLeft: The origin of coordinates is in the bottom-left corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the bottom-left corner of the image or text;
  • bottomRight: The origin of coordinates is in the bottom-right corner of the video, and the origin of the watermark is in the bottom-right corner of the image or text.
members.name: CoordinateOrigin

members.document: Workflow ID.

Workflow status. Valid values:
  • Enabled: Enabled,
  • Disabled: Disabled.

Type parameter of a video content recognition task.

members.document:
Event notification information of a task. If this parameter is left empty, no event notifications will be obtained.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document: Task flow priority. The higher the value, the higher the priority. Value range: [-10, 10]. If this parameter is left empty, 0 will be used.
